definition: to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to

sentences.english: Where spending hours in the sun is a daily summer habit, more and more sunbathers are using sunscreen.
sentences.chinese: 晒太阳是夏天日常习惯，越来越多的人用太阳油。

sentences.english: I was catching a suntan and these papers started blowin' in my face.
sentences.chinese: 我正在晒太阳，一些报纸吹到我的脸上。

sentences.english: Mimi" likes to lie onthe floor in the sunshine. She feels;comfortable that way.
sentences.chinese: “咪咪”喜欢躺在地板上晒太阳，它觉得很舒服。

sentences.english: Visit Nice, the Old Nice, Beach and the Sunshine of Mediterranean TGV.
sentences.chinese: 参观尼斯旧城，海滩，及晒太阳。

sentences.english: Lizards and other cold-blooded critters bask in the sun to keep warm.
sentences.chinese: 蜥蜴和其他冷血生物都会晒晒太阳，以保持温暖。

sentences.english: The dooryard used to be the place where we enjoyed sunshine in the winter afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 前院是我们冬日下午里晒太阳的地方。

sentences.english: You need to get some sun.
I'll get the cast and go for sardines. Will you sit in the sun in the doorway?
sentences.chinese: 我拿鱼网捞沙丁鱼去。你坐在门口晒晒太阳可好？

sentences.english: He had saved enough money so that he could live in comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他们可能正座在甲板上舒舒服服地晒太阳。

sentences.english: The dog sunned itself in the front porch.
In Spain she had a good time swimming and sun-bathing in the beach.
sentences.chinese: 在西班牙，他又游泳又在海滩上晒太阳，过的很愉快。

sentences.english: and in the summer time you see a lot of people over there getting some sun.
sentences.chinese: 在夏天，你可以看到许多人在那里晒太阳。

sentences.english: We are lying on the beach and are baked by the sun.
sentences.chinese: 我们正躺在海滩上晒太阳。

sentences.english: You can go have a barbecue, play volleyball for the day, tan, have fun on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 你可以去烧烤，打排球，晒太阳，在沙滩上玩耍。

sentences.english: We were sunning in the yard.

definition: to take a walk/to go for a walk
to cool off in the shade
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to bathe/to immerse oneself in a warm bath
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
(fig.) to have a meeting with state security agents (to be warned to behave "responsibly")
erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]
to stroll/to go for a walk
